intro: Portulaca triangularis, commonly known as the triangular moss rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing annual herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that are often triangular in shape, giving it its scientific name. The plant produces vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Its ability to store water in its leaves allows it to survive in arid conditions, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments.
